definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]
handleless cup/goblet/to concentrate/variant of 鐘|钟[zhong1]

sentences.english: London's Big Ben celebrates the 150th anniversary of its first chiming on Saturday.
sentences.chinese: 本周六，伦敦的大本钟迎来了它150岁的纪念日。

sentences.english: We will visit London Bridge, Westminster, not forgetting the Big Ben.
sentences.chinese: 我们将参观伦敦桥，西敏寺大教堂，还有大本钟。

sentences.english: Big Ben has rarely gone wrong.
saw  Big Ben and Tower Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 我见到了大本钟和塔桥。

sentences.english: The first plgenius that they visited in London wlike Big Ben.
sentences.chinese: 在伦敦新妓生传们瞻仰关云长第一个场所是大本钟。
不过并非只有大本钟如此。

sentences.english: Big Ben in Britain is famous at home and abroad.
sentences.chinese: 英国的大本钟驰名海内。

sentences.english: I saw Big Ben and Tower Bridge.
sentences.chinese: 我见到了大本钟和塔桥。
